Articles.Content: [5 mins till the AMA.](http://www.reddit.com/r/IAmA/comments/33ys4s/we_are_the_team_behind_kerbal_space_program/?sort=top)

Ksp mainpage is down due to "maintenance". The Hypetrain is about to crash into its final destination like a ton of Ununocticum hitting the wall of a Hadron Collider with a phononic frequency of over 9000 GHz!

> 
> 2 months is ridiculous right?

It could be something really subtle, but then again, telling people that theres an easter egg guarantees that it'll be found pretty quick.

> 
> Perfect music for the HypeTrain:
> [https://youtu.be/vsR9nL0cJJU](https://youtu.be/vsR9nL0cJJU)
> 
> Everyone needs to listen to that in loop, double speed, while waiting and watching this thread.

I'm glad you told me about this. AND IT WORKS!
I am so tempted to stay up till midnight but I am in EST so it's actually 1am... I am waking up at 5am anyways so it's really like waking up at 4am!!! (Just in case my wildest dreams come true)

> 
> [5 mins till the AMA.](http://www.reddit.com/r/IAmA/comments/33ys4s/we_are_the_team_behind_kerbal_space_program/?sort=top)

Silly question: What's an AMA? I assume we're not talking about the Angolan Music Awards, here?

> 
> Silly question: What's an AMA? I assume we're not talking about the Angolan Music Awards, here?

Ask Me Anything.

As for the AMA, those that have reddit accounts, could you ask about the deltaV and SPH/VAB aerodynamic overlay stuff? The overlay is now in the debug menu, but delta V doesn't seem like something hard to do, programming wise.
Guys, we need to wait until midnight and countdown like new years, someone, if you still have your plastic disco ball that you won from chucke cheeses, drop it at midnight.

> 
> Guys, we need to wait until midnight and countdown like new years, someone, if you still have your plastic disco ball that you won from chucke cheeses, drop it at midnight.

Define timezone...
past midnight here...

> 
> Define timezone...

Central is Squads timezone

> 
> past midnight here...

12:07am here.
Oh. I'm eastern time.

> 
> central is squads timezone

gmt -?
only 5:06 here
01:08 AM right here.

It seems like slightly bad form to put your marketing site in maintenance mode the day before the biggest release you have ever made. I am assuming a bunch of people who have never played are visiting the site to hear what all the hype is about only to find a server migration error.

Hype + Hype = Boom.
Mexico City is central timezone

GUYS! I tried going to KSP.com, it says it is in maintenance! OMG!

It says this:

[h=1]Server Migration[/h]Kerbal Space Program website is in maintenance mode while we are performing a Server Migration.

We appreciate your patience.

- Squad Team

> 
> It seems like slightly bad form to put your marketing site in maintenance mode the day before the biggest release you have ever made. I am assuming a bunch of people who have never played are visiting the site to hear what all the hype is about only to find a server migration error.
> Hype + Hype = Boom.

It's better than in the release day all the site crash for some hours due to the huge number of downloads
They're probably just making sure servers are okay for release tomorrow
I'm curious: Will aerocaptures around Duna's thin, thin atmosphere be safer, or still be fatal and require a heatshield?

Guys, only 5 flipping more pages until we reach 200!

Hype on!

> 
> It's better than in the release day all the site crash for some hours due to the huge number of downloads

Very very true.
